alert.note: Alert for St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Lafourche (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 5:22PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern St. John The Baptist, southeastern St. James, southwestern St. Charles and north central Lafourche Parishes through 545 PM CDT... At 520 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over South Vacherie, or 12 miles southwest of Reserve, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hahnville, Paradis, Des Allemands, South Vacherie, North Vacherie, Luling, Boutte, Bayou Gauche, Ama, Chackbay, Destrehan, St. Rose and Raceland. This includes Interstate 310 between mile markers 7 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Lac des Allemands, Lake Boeuf, or Lake Salvador, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for southeastern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Lafourche
